smell_analysis.justification: All diagrams provided in the PDF contain model elements and are not empty.

On the Use Case Diagram 'Autode halduse funktsionaalne allsüsteem (Muuda)' (Page 3), the use case 'Lisa auto' is not associated with any actor. While it has an «include» relationship to another use case, it lacks a direct or inherited association to an initiating actor like 'Autode haldur'.

While 'Lisa auto' and 'Registreeri auto' (Page 3) seem semantically redundant, 'Lisa auto' is not connected to the actor 'Autode haldur' (see G5.2), so the strict condition of two synonymous use cases being 'associated with the same actor' is not met.
No distinct model elements with identical names were found within the same package.

No obvious redundant data columns (denormalization) unconnected by foreign keys were found. Repeated columns like 'nimetus' appear in separate tables (Auto vs Auto_mark) representing distinct entities or are standard audit fields.
All use cases appear to use a consistent 'Verb + Noun' naming convention (e.g., 'Registreeri auto', 'Vaata aktiivseid autosid').
In the State Diagram 'Auto seisundidiagramm' (Page 9), all states (Ootel, Aktiivne, etc.) are reachable from the Start node via defined transitions.
In the Activity Diagram 'Auto lõpetamise tegevusdiagramm' (Page 4), all actions are reachable through the decision flows.

On the Class Diagram 'Töötajate register' (Page 10), the association between the class 'Töötaja_rolli_omamine' and the class 'Töötaja_roll' shows a multiplicity of '1' at the 'Töötaja_roll' end, but implies a missing multiplicity indicator (e.g., 0..*) at the 'Töötaja_rolli_omamine' end.
No single diagram contains 10 or more central elements (classes, tables, use cases, or states). The most complex diagrams (e.g., Page 3, Page 15) remain below this threshold.
No class or table has 6 or more visual connection lines on a single diagram. The 'Auto' table on Page 18 comes closest with 5 connections.

On the Database Diagram 'Isikute register' (Page 14), the table 'Kasutajakonto' is positioned on the far right, making the relationship line to the 'Isik' table significantly longer (more than twice the average distance) compared to the short connections between 'Isik' and its classifier tables.
All use cases and activity actions start with active verbs (e.g., 'Vaata', 'Otsi', 'Vali').
No class, table, attribute, or use case names were found to be 3 characters or less. Shortest names like 'Isik', 'Riik', 'Auto' are 4 characters long.
Class names (e.g., 'Isik', 'Auto', 'Töötaja') are properly capitalized and singular.
Attribute and column names (e.g., 'eesnimi', 'reg_aeg') consistently start with lowercase letters.
No Hungarian notation or disallowed prefixes were found in class, table, or attribute names. Prefixes like 'PK_' and 'FK_' found in the database diagrams are explicitly allowed.
